item.title: R to @martha_again: what a way to write a book, you simply cannot fault it. I'm also reading Moby Dick right now so am having a very Famed Good & Weird Literary Classic In 'Good & Weird' Shocker sort of a month
item.dc:creator: @martha_again
item.description: what a way to write a book, you simply cannot fault it. I'm also reading Moby Dick right now so am having a very Famed Good & Weird Literary Classic In 'Good & Weird' Shocker sort of a month

item.title: can't stop thinking about chapter IV of The Leopard which is 1/3rd social comedy of manners, 1/3 dreamlike description of lovers erotically exploring sinister forgotten wings of a crumbling baroque palace, 1/3 8-page-long monologue on the death drive inherent in being Sicilian üëå

item.title: RT by @martha_again: This is so frustrating. The scammer has impersonated Jenny, @NicolaBarr123 and @JamesMustelier so far. Obviously no TBA agent would ever ask for reading fees, but please know that none of us would solicit manuscripts in this way.
item.dc:creator: @mollykh
item.description:

item.title: I am enjoying Sybille Bedford's autobiographical novel JIGSAW because I firmly believe that what a book should be is a completely unstructured list of meals eaten in various European locations during the twentieth century, plus gossip

item.description: I am enjoying Sybille Bedford's autobiographical novel JIGSAW because I firmly believe that what a book should be is a completely unstructured list of meals eaten in various European locations during the twentieth century, plus gossip

item.title: R to @martha_again: Avery and I talk about this a lot and we often think the best thing someone could do is trawl the midwest in a van for a few weeks and bring it all back here to sell

item.title: R to @imogen_cassels: I follow a lot of US sellers on instagram and it is sad just quantitatively how much more stuff they have than the UK sellers (because of higher population/wealth in the decades I'm interested in I guess)
item.dc:creator: @martha_again
